talk-id-10.talkDescription: Surviving a build-release cycle of a legacy Backbone+Query project that is slowly evolving into Vue 3, Pinia, Typescript, Vite, and Vitest.

talk-id-20.talkDescription: Explore Directus with our startup's insights and a live coding demo, showcasing custom Vue.js plugins and shortcuts for data engineering.

slides.title: Unleashing the Power of Directus: Revolutionizing Data Management for Startups

talk-id-30.talkTitle: How to put your code in prod
talk-id-30.talkDescription: At Torq, we strive to continuously and safely deploy code to production as quickly as possible. Let's discuss the strategies and processes we utilize to achieve this goal

slides.title: Unleashing the Power of Directus: Revolutionizing Data Management for Startups

talk-id-40.talkDescription: Let's explore how we can develop a reliable and efficient strategy for component development and testing with Vitest

slides.title: Unleashing the Power of Directus: Revolutionizing Data Management for Startups

talk-id-50.talkDescription: What is a design system? Why we decided to implement a design system @Contentsquare and how it helped us speed up our development process

talk-id-60.talkTitle: Writing full-stack code without repeating yourself
talk-id-60.talkDescription: Live coding session, where we'll turn a front-end VueJS app into a full-stack app with code that is easy to write, follow, and, most importantly - maintain. Using: VueJS, node js, express, Postgres and remult

talk-id-70.talkDescription: Take a look into our process of always staying up to date with Vue and see how we faced the questions of how, when and for how long will we upgrade to Vue 3.

talk-id-80.talkTitle: Development the right way with Vue 3
talk-id-80.talkDescription: How to structure a design system and expose it to your product/design team using Storybook/Histoire

talk-id-100.talkTitle: Vue Microfrontends - How Vuex Saved the Day

slides.title: Successful building a large Vue 3 application

talk-id-160.talkDescription: Tips, tricks, and guidelines that can be applied to any vue2/vue3 application and will make you a star Developer.

talk-id-170.talkTitle: Vuex? No, it's XState for Vue
talk-id-170.talkDescription: Let's explore how we can fully control our app's states and develop a more adaptive UI system to users' behavior while keeping the codebase scalable with state machines, in real time.

talk-id-180.talkDescription: Meet the Quasar framework based on Vuejs, and create a cross-platform solution in an easy and peaceful way. We'll see some nice UI components, Capacitor for mobile development, PWA and various configurations that we've got out of the box.

talk-id-190.talkDescription: Tailwind is a highly customizable CSS framework for rapidly building custom designs. It provides low-level utility classes that you can use to control every visual aspect of your page without ever leaving your HTML. In this talk, we will not only explain the basic concepts of Tailwind but also share our experience of using it and reflect on how you get the most out of it.

talk-id-200.talkDescription: How to create a UI Library that provides users the most possible freedom in customizing components, while keeping our performance and scalability to the fullest? What other lessons learned, during building StorefrontUl, that can help other Vue developers in building their own system?

talk-id-210.talkDescription: A personal story on how choosing one of the best Vue UI frameworks turned out to do more damage than help, and how to avoid this mistake in the future.

talk-id-250.talkDescription: How @Nilos strives to enhance the Dx with Nuxt3 to onboard faster on different products.

talk-id-260.talkDescription: A discussion around the power of Vue when building a Design System and a look at the elements and tools that make up a scalable, consistent, reusable component library.

talk-id-270.talkDescription: Diving into the technology disruption @Yad2 in the last year, moving to VueJS and Nuxt, the challenges we faced and the conclusions we reached, how we dealt with memory leaks, responsive app, constantly refactoring our architecture to better suite our needs, important tips, do's and don'ts we took with us.

talk-id-280.talkTitle: Get your dynamic app up and running fast with Gridlify (Gridsome + Netlify).
talk-id-280.talkDescription: Keen to have fun building web applications and get some tasty JAM out of the stack of Gridsome and Netlify? Let's build Progressive web apps, SEO friendly. fast and dynamic in a 'static' way. entirely server-less.

talk-id-290.talkTitle: Production-Ready Vue Websites with NutS in Depth.
talk-id-290.talkDescription: SSR development in-depth. SSR compared to SPA apps. How NutS speeds up development and adds ease-of-use.

talk-id-300.talkDescription: What are Microinteractions? A glance through the lens of a web developer. From UX aspects to actual code examples and on to understanding the building blocks.

talk-id-310.talkDescription: Lets start deep and go deeper, this will be a fun journey of code - from the basics of Vue and quickly into the art of using dynamic components to build generic stuff (meta-applications)

talk-id-320.talkTitle: Universal App with NuxtJS better, simpler and easier SSR solution
talk-id-320.talkDescription: This talk is about the concept of universal apps, and how developers can create univeral apps easily with NuxtJS while speeding up development process and keeping KISS rules.

talk-id-321.talkDescription: Best practice in Vue, learned from experience with the best and the worst practices you can ever imagine

talk-id-322.talkTitle: Unlock the power of visual testing with Vitest
talk-id-322.talkDescription: How to develop a reliable and efficient strategy for visual testing with Vitest

talk-id-340.talkDescription: In a fast-changing world, from AI to frontend tech – our mindset must keep up. Discover how Vue + Astro help us build quickly and stay ready for what's next.

talk-id-350.talkTitle: Powering your Vue.js Application using PixiJS
talk-id-350.talkDescription: Discover how combining Vue.js with PixiJS can transform your web applications from static to extraordinary. Explores practical integration techniques, and performance optimizations.

talk-id-360.talkDescription: How to architecture our App State management efficiently with Pinia and TanStack Query

talk-id-370.talkTitle: What good is an app without happy users?
talk-id-370.talkDescription: Let's explore how small Vue coding patterns can have a big impact on performance.With some attention and care, we can keep our apps smooth, responsive, and readyto delight users!

talk-id-380.talkTitle: Vue Meets TanStack DB Live Queries, Optimistic Updates, and Beyond
talk-id-380.talkDescription: Master TanStack DB in Vue! Learn live queries, optimistic updates, and transactions to build dynamic, offline-first applications that sync with any backend.Practical insights and best practices included.
